00032 /*
00033  * lustre/obdclass/llog_osd.c
00034  *
00035  * Low level llog routines on top of OSD API
00036  *
00037  * This file provides set of methods for llog operations on top of
00038  * dt_device. It contains all supported llog_operations interfaces and
00039  * supplimental functions.
00040  *
00041  * Author: Alexey Zhuravlev <alexey.zhuravlev@intel.com>
00042  * Author: Mikhail Pershin <mike.pershin@intel.com>
00043  */
00044 
00045 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LOG
00046 
00047 #include <dt_object.h>
00048 #include <llog_swab.h>
00049 #include <lustre_fid.h>
00050 #include <obd.h>
00051 #include <obd_class.h>

00053 #include "llog_internal.h"
00054 #include "local_storage.h"

00070 static int llog_osd_declare_new_object(const struct lu_env *env,
00071                                        struct local_oid_storage *los,
00072                                        struct dt_object *o,
00073                                        struct thandle *th)
00074 {
00075         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
00076 
00077         lgi->lgi_attr.la_valid = LA_MODE;
00078         lgi->lgi_attr.la_mode = S_IFREG | S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR;
00079         lgi->lgi_dof.dof_type = dt_mode_to_dft(S_IFREG);
00080 
00081         return local_object_declare_create(env, los, o, &lgi->lgi_attr,
00082                                            &lgi->lgi_dof, th);
00083 }
00084 
00099 static int llog_osd_create_new_object(const struct lu_env *env,
00100                                       struct local_oid_storage *los,
00101                                       struct dt_object *o,
00102                                       struct thandle *th)
00103 {
00104         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
00105 
00106         lgi->lgi_attr.la_valid = LA_MODE;
00107         lgi->lgi_attr.la_mode = S_IFREG | S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR;
00108         lgi->lgi_dof.dof_type = dt_mode_to_dft(S_IFREG);
00109 
00110         return local_object_create(env, los, o, &lgi->lgi_attr,
00111                                    &lgi->lgi_dof, th);
00112 }
00113 
00124 static int llog_osd_exist(struct llog_handle *handle)
00125 {
00126         LASSERT(handle->lgh_obj);
00127         return dt_object_exists(handle->lgh_obj) &&
00128                 !lu_object_is_dying(handle->lgh_obj->do_lu.lo_header);
00129 }
00130 
00153 static int llog_osd_pad(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_object *o,
00154                         loff_t *off, int len, int index, struct thandle *th)
00155 {
00156         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
00157         struct llog_rec_hdr     *rec;
00158         struct llog_rec_tail    *tail;
00159         int                      rc;
00160 
00161         ENTRY;
00162 
00163         LASSERT(th);
00164         LASSERT(off);
00165         LASSERT(len >= LLOG_MIN_REC_SIZE && (len & 0x7) == 0);
00166 
00167         OBD_ALLOC(rec, len);
00168         if (rec == NULL)
00169                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00170 
00171         rec->lrh_len = len;
00172         rec->lrh_index = index;
00173         rec->lrh_type = LLOG_PAD_MAGIC;
00174 
00175         tail = rec_tail(rec);
00176         tail->lrt_len = len;
00177         tail->lrt_index = index;
00178 
00179         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = rec;
00180         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = len;
00181         rc = dt_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, off, th);
00182         if (rc)
00183                 CERROR("%s: error writing padding record: rc = %d\n",
00184                        o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name, rc);
00185 
00186         OBD_FREE(rec, len);
00187         RETURN(rc);
00188 }
00189 
00202 static int llog_osd_read_header(const struct lu_env *env,
00203                                 struct llog_handle *handle)
00204 {
00205         struct llog_rec_hdr     *llh_hdr;
00206         struct dt_object        *o;
00207         struct llog_thread_info *lgi;
00208         enum llog_flag           flags;
00209         int                      rc;
00210 
00211         ENTRY;
00212 
00213         o = handle->lgh_obj;
00214         LASSERT(o);
00215 
00216         lgi = llog_info(env);
00217 
00218         rc = dt_attr_get(env, o, &lgi->lgi_attr);
00219         if (rc)
00220                 RETURN(rc);
00221 
00222         LASSERT(lgi->lgi_attr.la_valid & LA_SIZE);
00223 
00224         if (lgi->lgi_attr.la_size == 0) {
00225                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "not reading header from 0-byte log\n");
00226                 RETURN(LLOG_EEMPTY);
00227         }
00228 
00229         flags = handle->lgh_hdr->llh_flags;
00230 
00231         lgi->lgi_off = 0;
00232         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = handle->lgh_hdr;
00233         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = handle->lgh_hdr_size;
00234         rc = dt_read(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, &lgi->lgi_off);
00235         llh_hdr = &handle->lgh_hdr->llh_hdr;
00236         if (rc < sizeof(*llh_hdr) || rc < llh_hdr->lrh_len) {
00237                 CERROR("%s: error reading "DFID" log header size %d: rc = %d\n",
00238                        o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
00239                        PFID(lu_object_fid(&o->do_lu)), rc < 0 ? 0 : rc,
00240                        -EFAULT);
00241 
00242                 if (rc >= 0)
00243                         rc = -EFAULT;
00244 
00245                 RETURN(rc);
00246         }
00247 
00248         if (LLOG_REC_HDR_NEEDS_SWABBING(llh_hdr))
00249                 lustre_swab_llog_hdr(handle->lgh_hdr);
00250 
00251         if (llh_hdr->lrh_type != LLOG_HDR_MAGIC) {
00252                 CERROR("%s: bad log %s "DFID" header magic: %#x "
00253                        "(expected %#x)\n", o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
00254                        handle->lgh_name ? handle->lgh_name : "",
00255                        PFID(lu_object_fid(&o->do_lu)),
00256                        llh_hdr->lrh_type, LLOG_HDR_MAGIC);
00257                 RETURN(-EIO);
00258         } else if (llh_hdr->lrh_len < LLOG_MIN_CHUNK_SIZE ||
00259                    llh_hdr->lrh_len > handle->lgh_hdr_size) {
00260                 CERROR("%s: incorrectly sized log %s "DFID" header: "
00261                        "%#x (expected at least %#x)\n"
00262                        "you may need to re-run lconf --write_conf.\n",
00263                        o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
00264                        handle->lgh_name ? handle->lgh_name : "",
00265                        PFID(lu_object_fid(&o->do_lu)),
00266                        llh_hdr->lrh_len, LLOG_MIN_CHUNK_SIZE);
00267                 RETURN(-EIO);
00268         } else if (LLOG_HDR_TAIL(handle->lgh_hdr)->lrt_index >
00269                    LLOG_HDR_BITMAP_SIZE(handle->lgh_hdr) ||
00270                    LLOG_HDR_TAIL(handle->lgh_hdr)->lrt_len !=
00271                         llh_hdr->lrh_len) {
00272                 CERROR("%s: incorrectly sized log %s "DFID" tailer: "
00273                        "%#x : rc = %d\n",
00274                        o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
00275                        handle->lgh_name ? handle->lgh_name : "",
00276                        PFID(lu_object_fid(&o->do_lu)),
00277                        LLOG_HDR_TAIL(handle->lgh_hdr)->lrt_len, -EIO);
00278                 RETURN(-EIO);
00279         }
00280 
00281         handle->lgh_hdr->llh_flags |= (flags & LLOG_F_EXT_MASK);
00282         handle->lgh_last_idx = LLOG_HDR_TAIL(handle->lgh_hdr)->lrt_index;
00283         handle->lgh_write_offset = lgi->lgi_attr.la_size;
00284 
00285         RETURN(0);
00286 }
00287 
00307 static int llog_osd_declare_write_rec(const struct lu_env *env,
00308                                       struct llog_handle *loghandle,
00309                                       struct llog_rec_hdr *rec,
00310                                       int idx, struct thandle *th)
00311 {
00312         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
00313         __u32                   chunk_size;
00314         struct dt_object        *o;
00315         int                      rc;
00316 
00317         ENTRY;
00318 
00319         LASSERT(env);
00320         LASSERT(th);
00321         LASSERT(loghandle);
00322         LASSERT(rec);
00323         LASSERT(rec->lrh_len <= loghandle->lgh_ctxt->loc_chunk_size);
00324 
00325         o = loghandle->lgh_obj;
00326         LASSERT(o);
00327 
00328         chunk_size = loghandle->lgh_ctxt->loc_chunk_size;
00329         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = chunk_size;
00330         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = NULL;
00331         /* each time we update header */
00332         rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, 0,
00333                                      th);
00334         if (rc || idx == 0) /* if error or just header */
00335                 RETURN(rc);
00336 
00341         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = chunk_size * 2;
00342         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = NULL;
00343         /* XXX: implement declared window or multi-chunks approach */
00344         rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, -1, th);
00345 
00346         RETURN(rc);
00347 }
00348 
00372 static int llog_osd_write_rec(const struct lu_env *env,
00373                               struct llog_handle *loghandle,
00374                               struct llog_rec_hdr *rec,
00375                               struct llog_cookie *reccookie,
00376                               int idx, struct thandle *th)
00377 {
00378         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
00379         struct llog_log_hdr     *llh;
00380         int                      reclen = rec->lrh_len;
00381         int                      index, rc;
00382         struct llog_rec_tail    *lrt;
00383         struct dt_object        *o;
00384         __u32                   chunk_size;
00385         size_t                   left;
00386         __u32                   orig_last_idx;
00387         __u64                   orig_write_offset;
00388         ENTRY;
00389 
00390         LASSERT(env);
00391         llh = loghandle->lgh_hdr;
00392         LASSERT(llh);
00393         o = loghandle->lgh_obj;
00394         LASSERT(o);
00395         LASSERT(th);
00396 
00397         chunk_size = llh->llh_hdr.lrh_len;
00398         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "new record %x to "DFID"\n",
00399                rec->lrh_type, PFID(lu_object_fid(&o->do_lu)));
00400 
00401         if (!llog_osd_exist(loghandle))
00402                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00403 
00404         /* record length should not bigger than  */
00405         if (reclen > loghandle->lgh_hdr->llh_hdr.lrh_len)
00406                 RETURN(-E2BIG);
00407 
00408         /* sanity check for fixed-records llog */
00409         if (idx != LLOG_HEADER_IDX && (llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_FIXSIZE)) {
00410                 LASSERT(llh->llh_size != 0);
00411                 LASSERT(llh->llh_size == reclen);
00412         }
00413 
00414         rc = dt_attr_get(env, o, &lgi->lgi_attr);
00415         if (rc)
00416                 RETURN(rc);
00417 
00435         if (idx != LLOG_NEXT_IDX) {
00436                 /* llog can be empty only when first record is being written */
00437                 LASSERT(ergo(idx > 0, lgi->lgi_attr.la_size > 0));
00438 
00439                 if (!ext2_test_bit(idx, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh))) {
00440                         CERROR("%s: modify unset record %u\n",
00441                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name, idx);
00442                         RETURN(-ENOENT);
00443                 }
00444 
00445                 if (idx != rec->lrh_index) {
00446                         CERROR("%s: modify index mismatch %d %u\n",
00447                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name, idx,
00448                                rec->lrh_index);
00449                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
00450                 }
00451 
00452                 if (idx == LLOG_HEADER_IDX) {
00453                         /* llog header update */
00454                         __u32   *bitmap = LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh);
00455 
00456                         lgi->lgi_off = 0;
00457 
00458                         /* If it does not indicate the bitmap index
00459                          * (reccookie == NULL), then it means update
00460                          * the whole update header. Otherwise only
00461                          * update header and bits needs to be updated,
00462                          * and in DNE cases, it will signaficantly
00463                          * shrink the RPC size.
00464                          * see distribute_txn_cancel_records()*/
00465                         if (reccookie == NULL) {
00466                                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = reclen;
00467                                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = rec;
00468                                 rc = dt_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf,
00469                                                      &lgi->lgi_off, th);
00470                                 RETURN(rc);
00471                         }
00472 
00473                         /* update the header */
00474                         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = llh->llh_bitmap_offset;
00475                         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = llh;
00476                         rc = dt_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf,
00477                                              &lgi->lgi_off, th);
00478                         if (rc != 0)
00479                                 RETURN(rc);
00480 
00481                         /* update the bitmap */
00482                         index = reccookie->lgc_index;
00483                         lgi->lgi_off = llh->llh_bitmap_offset +
00484                                       (index / (sizeof(*bitmap) * 8)) *
00485                                                         sizeof(*bitmap);
00486                         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = sizeof(*bitmap);
00487                         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf =
00488                                         &bitmap[index/(sizeof(*bitmap)*8)];
00489                         rc = dt_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf,
00490                                              &lgi->lgi_off, th);
00491 
00492                         RETURN(rc);
00493                 } else if (loghandle->lgh_cur_idx > 0) {
00498                         if (idx != loghandle->lgh_cur_idx) {
00499                                 CERROR("%s: modify index mismatch %d %d\n",
00500                                        o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name, idx,
00501                                        loghandle->lgh_cur_idx);
00502                                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
00503                         }
00504 
00505                         lgi->lgi_off = loghandle->lgh_cur_offset;
00506                         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "modify record "DOSTID": idx:%d, "
00507                                "len:%u offset %llu\n",
00508                                POSTID(&loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_oi), idx,
00509                                rec->lrh_len, (long long)lgi->lgi_off);
00510                 } else if (llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_FIXSIZE) {
00511                         lgi->lgi_off = llh->llh_hdr.lrh_len +
00512                                        (idx - 1) * reclen;
00513                 } else {
00514                         /* This can be result of lgh_cur_idx is not set during
00515                          * llog processing or llh_size is not set to proper
00516                          * record size for fixed records llog. Therefore it is
00517                          * impossible to get record offset. */
00518                         CERROR("%s: can't get record offset, idx:%d, "
00519                                "len:%u.\n", o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
00520                                idx, rec->lrh_len);
00521                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
00522                 }
00523 
00524                 /* update only data, header and tail remain the same */
00525                 lgi->lgi_off += sizeof(struct llog_rec_hdr);
00526                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = REC_DATA_LEN(rec);
00527                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = REC_DATA(rec);
00528                 rc = dt_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, &lgi->lgi_off, th);
00529                 if (rc == 0 && reccookie) {
00530                         reccookie->lgc_lgl = loghandle->lgh_id;
00531                         reccookie->lgc_index = idx;
00532                         rc = 1;
00533                 }
00534                 RETURN(rc);
00535         }
00536 
00549         /* simulate ENOSPC when new plain llog is being added to the
00550          * catalog */
00551         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDS_LLOG_CREATE_FAILED2) &&
00552             llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT)
00553                 RETURN(-ENOSPC);
00554 
00555         LASSERT(lgi->lgi_attr.la_valid & LA_SIZE);
00556         orig_last_idx = loghandle->lgh_last_idx;
00557         orig_write_offset = loghandle->lgh_write_offset;
00558         lgi->lgi_off = lgi->lgi_attr.la_size;
00559         left = chunk_size - (lgi->lgi_off & (chunk_size - 1));
00560         /* NOTE: padding is a record, but no bit is set */
00561         if (left != 0 && left != reclen &&
00562             left < (reclen + LLOG_MIN_REC_SIZE)) {
00563                 index = loghandle->lgh_last_idx + 1;
00564                 rc = llog_osd_pad(env, o, &lgi->lgi_off, left, index, th);
00565                 if (rc)
00566                         RETURN(rc);
00567 
00568                 if (dt_object_remote(o))
00569                         loghandle->lgh_write_offset = lgi->lgi_off;
00570 
00571                 loghandle->lgh_last_idx++; /* for pad rec */
00572         }
00573         /* if it's the last idx in log file, then return -ENOSPC
00574          * or wrap around if a catalog */
00575         if (llog_is_full(loghandle) ||
00576             unlikely(llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT &&
00577                      OBD_FAIL_PRECHECK(OBD_FAIL_CAT_RECORDS) &&
00578                      loghandle->lgh_last_idx >= cfs_fail_val)) {
00579                 if (llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT)
00580                         loghandle->lgh_last_idx = 0;
00581                 else
00582                         RETURN(-ENOSPC);
00583         }
00584 
00585         /* increment the last_idx along with llh_tail index, they should
00586          * be equal for a llog lifetime */
00587         loghandle->lgh_last_idx++;
00588         index = loghandle->lgh_last_idx;
00589         LLOG_HDR_TAIL(llh)->lrt_index = index;
00595         LASSERT(index < LLOG_HDR_BITMAP_SIZE(llh));
00596         rec->lrh_index = index;
00597         lrt = rec_tail(rec);
00598         lrt->lrt_len = rec->lrh_len;
00599         lrt->lrt_index = rec->lrh_index;
00600 
00601         /* the lgh_hdr_mutex protects llog header data from concurrent
00602          * update/cancel, the llh_count and llh_bitmap are protected */
00603         mutex_lock(&loghandle->lgh_hdr_mutex);
00604         if (ext2_set_bit(index, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh))) {
00605                 CERROR("%s: index %u already set in log bitmap\n",
00606                        o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name, index);
00607                 mutex_unlock(&loghandle->lgh_hdr_mutex);
00608                 LBUG(); /* should never happen */
00609         }
00610         llh->llh_count++;
00611 
00612         if (!(llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_FIXSIZE)) {
00613                 /* Update the minimum size of the llog record */
00614                 if (llh->llh_size == 0)
00615                         llh->llh_size = reclen;
00616                 else if (reclen < llh->llh_size)
00617                         llh->llh_size = reclen;
00618         }
00619 
00620         if (lgi->lgi_attr.la_size == 0) {
00621                 lgi->lgi_off = 0;
00622                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = llh->llh_hdr.lrh_len;
00623                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = &llh->llh_hdr;
00624                 rc = dt_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, &lgi->lgi_off, th);
00625                 if (rc != 0)
00626                         GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
00627         } else {
00628                 __u32   *bitmap = LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh);
00629 
00630                 /* Note: If this is not initialization (size == 0), then do not
00631                  * write the whole header (8k bytes), only update header/tail
00632                  * and bits needs to be updated. Because this update might be
00633                  * part of cross-MDT operation, which needs to write these
00634                  * updates into the update log(32KB limit) and also pack inside
00635                  * the RPC (1MB limit), if we write 8K for each operation, which
00636                  * will cost a lot space, and keep us adding more updates to one
00637                  * update log.*/
00638                 lgi->lgi_off = 0;
00639                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = llh->llh_bitmap_offset;
00640                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = &llh->llh_hdr;
00641                 rc = dt_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, &lgi->lgi_off, th);
00642                 if (rc != 0)
00643                         GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
00644 
00645                 lgi->lgi_off = llh->llh_bitmap_offset +
00646                               (index / (sizeof(*bitmap) * 8)) * sizeof(*bitmap);
00647                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = sizeof(*bitmap);
00648                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = &bitmap[index/(sizeof(*bitmap)*8)];
00649                 rc = dt_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, &lgi->lgi_off, th);
00650                 if (rc != 0)
00651                         GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
00652 
00653                 lgi->lgi_off =  (unsigned long)LLOG_HDR_TAIL(llh) -
00654                                 (unsigned long)llh;
00655                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = sizeof(llh->llh_tail);
00656                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = LLOG_HDR_TAIL(llh);
00657                 rc = dt_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, &lgi->lgi_off, th);
00658                 if (rc != 0)
00659                         GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
00660         }
00661 
00662 out_unlock:
00663         /* unlock here for remote object */
00664         mutex_unlock(&loghandle->lgh_hdr_mutex);
00665         if (rc)
00666                 GOTO(out, rc);
00667 
00668         /* computed index can be used to determine offset for fixed-size
00669          * records. This also allows to handle Catalog wrap around case */
00670         if (llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_FIXSIZE) {
00671                 lgi->lgi_off = llh->llh_hdr.lrh_len + (index - 1) * reclen;
00672         } else if (dt_object_remote(o)) {
00673                 lgi->lgi_off = max_t(__u64, loghandle->lgh_write_offset,
00674                                      lgi->lgi_off);
00675         } else {
00676                 rc = dt_attr_get(env, o, &lgi->lgi_attr);
00677                 if (rc)
00678                         GOTO(out, rc);
00679 
00680                 LASSERT(lgi->lgi_attr.la_valid & LA_SIZE);
00681                 lgi->lgi_off = max_t(__u64, lgi->lgi_attr.la_size,
00682                                      lgi->lgi_off);
00683         }
00684 
00685         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = reclen;
00686         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = rec;
00687         rc = dt_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, &lgi->lgi_off, th);
00688         if (rc < 0)
00689                 GOTO(out, rc);
00690 
00691         if (dt_object_remote(o))
00692                 loghandle->lgh_write_offset = lgi->lgi_off;
00693 
00694         CDEBUG(D_HA, "added record "DFID": idx: %u, %u off"LPU64"\n",
00695                PFID(lu_object_fid(&o->do_lu)), index, rec->lrh_len,
00696                lgi->lgi_off);
00697         if (reccookie != NULL) {
00698                 reccookie->lgc_lgl = loghandle->lgh_id;
00699                 reccookie->lgc_index = index;
00700                 if ((rec->lrh_type == MDS_UNLINK_REC) ||
00701                     (rec->lrh_type == MDS_SETATTR64_REC))
00702                         reccookie->lgc_subsys = LLOG_MDS_OST_ORIG_CTXT;
00703                 else if (rec->lrh_type == OST_SZ_REC)
00704                         reccookie->lgc_subsys = LLOG_SIZE_ORIG_CTXT;
00705                 else
00706                         reccookie->lgc_subsys = -1;
00707                 rc = 1;
00708         }
00709         RETURN(rc);
00710 out:
00711         /* cleanup llog for error case */
00712         mutex_lock(&loghandle->lgh_hdr_mutex);
00713         ext2_clear_bit(index, LLOG_HDR_BITMAP(llh));
00714         llh->llh_count--;
00715         mutex_unlock(&loghandle->lgh_hdr_mutex);
00716 
00717         /* restore llog last_idx */
00718         if (dt_object_remote(o)) {
00719                 loghandle->lgh_last_idx = orig_last_idx;
00720                 loghandle->lgh_write_offset = orig_write_offset;
00721         } else if (--loghandle->lgh_last_idx == 0 &&
00722             (llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_CAT) && llh->llh_cat_idx != 0) {
00723                 /* catalog had just wrap-around case */
00724                 loghandle->lgh_last_idx = LLOG_HDR_BITMAP_SIZE(llh) - 1;
00725         }
00726 
00727         LLOG_HDR_TAIL(llh)->lrt_index = loghandle->lgh_last_idx;
00728 
00729         RETURN(rc);
00730 }
00731 
00750 static inline void llog_skip_over(struct llog_handle *lgh, __u64 *off,
00751                                   int curr, int goal, __u32 chunk_size,
00752                                   bool force_mini_rec)
00753 {
00754         struct llog_log_hdr *llh = lgh->lgh_hdr;
00755 
00756         /* Goal should not bigger than the record count */
00757         if (goal > lgh->lgh_last_idx)
00758                 goal = lgh->lgh_last_idx;
00759 
00760         if (goal > curr) {
00761                 if (llh->llh_flags & LLOG_F_IS_FIXSIZE) {
00762                         *off = chunk_size + (goal - 1) * llh->llh_size;
00763                 } else {
00764                         __u64 min_rec_size = LLOG_MIN_REC_SIZE;
00765 
00766                         if (llh->llh_size > 0 && !force_mini_rec)
00767                                 min_rec_size = llh->llh_size;
00768 
00769                         *off = *off + (goal - curr - 1) * min_rec_size;
00770                 }
00771         }
00772         /* always align with lower chunk boundary*/
00773         *off &= ~(chunk_size - 1);
00774 }
00775 
00787 static void changelog_block_trim_ext(struct llog_rec_hdr *hdr,
00788                                      struct llog_rec_hdr *last_hdr,
00789                                      enum changelog_rec_flags flags)
00790 {
00791         if (hdr->lrh_type != CHANGELOG_REC)
00792                 return;
00793 
00794         do {
00795                 struct changelog_rec *rec = (struct changelog_rec *)(hdr + 1);
00796 
00797                 changelog_remap_rec(rec, rec->cr_flags & flags);
00798                 hdr = llog_rec_hdr_next(hdr);
00799         } while ((char *)hdr <= (char *)last_hdr);
00800 }
00801 
00820 static int llog_osd_next_block(const struct lu_env *env,
00821                                struct llog_handle *loghandle, int *cur_idx,
00822                                int next_idx, __u64 *cur_offset, void *buf,
00823                                int len)
00824 {
00825         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
00826         struct dt_object        *o;
00827         struct dt_device        *dt;
00828         int                      rc;
00829         __u32                   chunk_size;
00830         int last_idx = *cur_idx;
00831         __u64 last_offset = *cur_offset;
00832         bool force_mini_rec = false;
00833 
00834         ENTRY;
00835 
00836         LASSERT(env);
00837         LASSERT(lgi);
00838 
00839         chunk_size = loghandle->lgh_hdr->llh_hdr.lrh_len;
00840         if (len == 0 || len & (chunk_size - 1))
00841                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00842 
00843         LASSERT(loghandle);
00844         LASSERT(loghandle->lgh_ctxt);
00845 
00846         o = loghandle->lgh_obj;
00847         LASSERT(o);
00848         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(o));
00849         dt = lu2dt_dev(o->do_lu.lo_dev);
00850         LASSERT(dt);
00851 
00852         rc = dt_attr_get(env, o, &lgi->lgi_attr);
00853         if (rc)
00854                 GOTO(out, rc);
00855 
00856         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "looking for log index %u (cur idx %u off"
00857                LPU64"), size %llu\n", next_idx, *cur_idx,
00858                *cur_offset, lgi->lgi_attr.la_size);
00859 
00860         while (*cur_offset < lgi->lgi_attr.la_size) {
00861                 struct llog_rec_hdr     *rec, *last_rec;
00862                 struct llog_rec_tail    *tail;
00863 
00864                 llog_skip_over(loghandle, cur_offset, *cur_idx,
00865                                next_idx, chunk_size, force_mini_rec);
00866 
00867                 /* read up to next llog chunk_size block */
00868                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = chunk_size -
00869                                       (*cur_offset & (chunk_size - 1));
00870                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = buf;
00871 
00872                 rc = dt_read(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, cur_offset);
00873                 if (rc < 0) {
00874                         if (rc == -EBADR && !force_mini_rec)
00875                                 goto retry;
00876 
00877                         CERROR("%s: can't read llog block from log "DFID
00878                                " offset "LPU64": rc = %d\n",
00879                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
00880                                PFID(lu_object_fid(&o->do_lu)), *cur_offset,
00881                                rc);
00882                         GOTO(out, rc);
00883                 }
00884 
00885                 if (rc < len) {
00886                         /* signal the end of the valid buffer to
00887                          * llog_process */
00888                         memset(buf + rc, 0, len - rc);
00889                 }
00890 
00891                 if (rc == 0) { /* end of file, nothing to do */
00892                         if (!force_mini_rec)
00893                                 goto retry;
00894                         GOTO(out, rc);
00895                 }
00896 
00897                 if (rc < sizeof(*tail)) {
00898                         if (!force_mini_rec)
00899                                 goto retry;
00900 
00901                         CERROR("%s: invalid llog block at log id "DOSTID"/%u "
00902                                "offset "LPU64"\n",
00903                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
00904                                POSTID(&loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_oi),
00905                                loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_ogen, *cur_offset);
00906                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00907                 }
00908 
00909                 rec = buf;
00910                 if (LLOG_REC_HDR_NEEDS_SWABBING(rec))
00911                         lustre_swab_llog_rec(rec);
00912 
00913                 tail = (struct llog_rec_tail *)((char *)buf + rc -
00914                                                 sizeof(struct llog_rec_tail));
00915                 /* get the last record in block */
00916                 last_rec = (struct llog_rec_hdr *)((char *)buf + rc -
00917                                                    tail->lrt_len);
00918 
00919                 if (LLOG_REC_HDR_NEEDS_SWABBING(last_rec))
00920                         lustre_swab_llog_rec(last_rec);
00921 
00922                 if (last_rec->lrh_index != tail->lrt_index) {
00923                         CERROR("%s: invalid llog tail at log id "DOSTID"/%u "
00924                                "offset "LPU64" last_rec idx %u tail idx %u\n",
00925                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
00926                                POSTID(&loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_oi),
00927                                loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_ogen, *cur_offset,
00928                                last_rec->lrh_index, tail->lrt_index);
00929                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00930                 }
00931 
00932                 *cur_idx = tail->lrt_index;
00933 
00934                 /* this shouldn't happen */
00935                 if (tail->lrt_index == 0) {
00936                         CERROR("%s: invalid llog tail at log id "DOSTID"/%u "
00937                                "offset "LPU64" bytes %d\n",
00938                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
00939                                POSTID(&loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_oi),
00940                                loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_ogen, *cur_offset, rc);
00941                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00942                 }
00943                 if (tail->lrt_index < next_idx) {
00944                         last_idx = *cur_idx;
00945                         last_offset = *cur_offset;
00946                         continue;
00947                 }
00948 
00949                 /* sanity check that the start of the new buffer is no farther
00950                  * than the record that we wanted.  This shouldn't happen. */
00951                 if (rec->lrh_index > next_idx) {
00952                         if (!force_mini_rec && next_idx > last_idx)
00953                                 goto retry;
00954 
00955                         CERROR("%s: missed desired record? %u > %u\n",
00956                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
00957                                rec->lrh_index, next_idx);
00958                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
00959                 }
00960 
00961                 /* Trim unsupported extensions for compat w/ older clients */
00962                 if (!(loghandle->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_EXT_JOBID))
00963                         changelog_block_trim_ext(rec, last_rec,
00964                                                  CLF_VERSION | CLF_RENAME);
00965 
00966                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00967 
00968 retry:
00969                 /* Note: because there are some pad records in the
00970                  * llog, so llog_skip_over() might skip too much
00971                  * records, let's try skip again with minimum record */
00972                 force_mini_rec = true;
00973                 *cur_offset = last_offset;
00974                 *cur_idx = last_idx;
00975         }
00976         GOTO(out, rc = -EIO);
00977 out:
00978         return rc;
00979 }
00980 
00998 static int llog_osd_prev_block(const struct lu_env *env,
00999                                struct llog_handle *loghandle,
01000                                int prev_idx, void *buf, int len)
01001 {
01002         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
01003         struct dt_object        *o;
01004         struct dt_device        *dt;
01005         loff_t                   cur_offset;
01006         __u32                   chunk_size;
01007         int                      rc;
01008 
01009         ENTRY;
01010 
01011         chunk_size = loghandle->lgh_hdr->llh_hdr.lrh_len;
01012         if (len == 0 || len & (chunk_size - 1))
01013                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01014 
01015         CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "looking for log index %u\n", prev_idx);
01016 
01017         LASSERT(loghandle);
01018         LASSERT(loghandle->lgh_ctxt);
01019 
01020         o = loghandle->lgh_obj;
01021         LASSERT(o);
01022         LASSERT(dt_object_exists(o));
01023         dt = lu2dt_dev(o->do_lu.lo_dev);
01024         LASSERT(dt);
01025 
01026         /* Let's only use mini record size for previous block read
01027          * for now XXX */
01028         cur_offset = chunk_size;
01029         llog_skip_over(loghandle, &cur_offset, 0, prev_idx,
01030                        chunk_size, true);
01031 
01032         rc = dt_attr_get(env, o, &lgi->lgi_attr);
01033         if (rc)
01034                 GOTO(out, rc);
01035 
01036         while (cur_offset < lgi->lgi_attr.la_size) {
01037                 struct llog_rec_hdr     *rec, *last_rec;
01038                 struct llog_rec_tail    *tail;
01039 
01040                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = len;
01041                 lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = buf;
01042                 rc = dt_read(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, &cur_offset);
01043                 if (rc < 0) {
01044                         CERROR("%s: can't read llog block from log "DFID
01045                                " offset "LPU64": rc = %d\n",
01046                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
01047                                PFID(lu_object_fid(&o->do_lu)), cur_offset, rc);
01048                         GOTO(out, rc);
01049                 }
01050 
01051                 if (rc == 0) /* end of file, nothing to do */
01052                         GOTO(out, rc);
01053 
01054                 if (rc < sizeof(*tail)) {
01055                         CERROR("%s: invalid llog block at log id "DOSTID"/%u "
01056                                "offset "LPU64"\n",
01057                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
01058                                POSTID(&loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_oi),
01059                                loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_ogen, cur_offset);
01060                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01061                 }
01062 
01063                 rec = buf;
01064                 if (LLOG_REC_HDR_NEEDS_SWABBING(rec))
01065                         lustre_swab_llog_rec(rec);
01066 
01067                 tail = (struct llog_rec_tail *)((char *)buf + rc -
01068                                                 sizeof(struct llog_rec_tail));
01069                 /* get the last record in block */
01070                 last_rec = (struct llog_rec_hdr *)((char *)buf + rc -
01071                                                    le32_to_cpu(tail->lrt_len));
01072 
01073                 if (LLOG_REC_HDR_NEEDS_SWABBING(last_rec))
01074                         lustre_swab_llog_rec(last_rec);
01075                 LASSERT(last_rec->lrh_index == tail->lrt_index);
01076 
01077                 /* this shouldn't happen */
01078                 if (tail->lrt_index == 0) {
01079                         CERROR("%s: invalid llog tail at log id "DOSTID"/%u "
01080                                "offset "LPU64"\n",
01081                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
01082                                POSTID(&loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_oi),
01083                                loghandle->lgh_id.lgl_ogen, cur_offset);
01084                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
01085                 }
01086                 if (tail->lrt_index < prev_idx)
01087                         continue;
01088 
01089                 /* sanity check that the start of the new buffer is no farther
01090                  * than the record that we wanted.  This shouldn't happen. */
01091                 if (rec->lrh_index > prev_idx) {
01092                         CERROR("%s: missed desired record? %u > %u\n",
01093                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
01094                                rec->lrh_index, prev_idx);
01095                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
01096                 }
01097 
01098                 /* Trim unsupported extensions for compat w/ older clients */
01099                 if (!(loghandle->lgh_hdr->llh_flags & LLOG_F_EXT_JOBID))
01100                         changelog_block_trim_ext(rec, last_rec,
01101                                                  CLF_VERSION | CLF_RENAME);
01102 
01103                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01104         }
01105         GOTO(out, rc = -EIO);
01106 out:
01107         return rc;
01108 }
01109 
01120 static struct dt_object *llog_osd_dir_get(const struct lu_env *env,
01121                                           struct llog_ctxt *ctxt)
01122 {
01123         struct dt_device        *dt;
01124         struct dt_thread_info   *dti = dt_info(env);
01125         struct dt_object        *dir;
01126         int                      rc;
01127 
01128         dt = ctxt->loc_exp->exp_obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.dt;
01129         if (ctxt->loc_dir == NULL) {
01130                 rc = dt_root_get(env, dt, &dti->dti_fid);
01131                 if (rc)
01132                         return ERR_PTR(rc);
01133                 dir = dt_locate(env, dt, &dti->dti_fid);
01134 
01135                 if (!IS_ERR(dir) && !dt_try_as_dir(env, dir)) {
01136                         lu_object_put(env, &dir->do_lu);
01137                         return ERR_PTR(-ENOTDIR);
01138                 }
01139         } else {
01140                 lu_object_get(&ctxt->loc_dir->do_lu);
01141                 dir = ctxt->loc_dir;
01142         }
01143 
01144         return dir;
01145 }
01146 
01168 static int llog_osd_open(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *handle,
01169                          struct llog_logid *logid, char *name,
01170                          enum llog_open_param open_param)
01171 {
01172         struct llog_thread_info         *lgi = llog_info(env);
01173         struct llog_ctxt                *ctxt = handle->lgh_ctxt;
01174         struct dt_object                *o;
01175         struct dt_device                *dt;
01176         struct ls_device                *ls;
01177         struct local_oid_storage        *los = NULL;
01178         int                              rc = 0;
01179 
01180         ENTRY;
01181 
01182         LASSERT(env);
01183         LASSERT(ctxt);
01184         LASSERT(ctxt->loc_exp);
01185         LASSERT(ctxt->loc_exp->exp_obd);
01186         dt = ctxt->loc_exp->exp_obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.dt;
01187         LASSERT(dt);
01188         if (ctxt->loc_flags & LLOG_CTXT_FLAG_NORMAL_FID) {
01189                 struct lu_object_conf conf = { 0 };
01190                 if (logid != NULL) {
01191                         logid_to_fid(logid, &lgi->lgi_fid);
01192                 } else {
01193                         /* If logid == NULL, then it means the caller needs
01194                          * to allocate new FID (llog_cat_declare_add_rec()). */
01195                         rc = obd_fid_alloc(env, ctxt->loc_exp,
01196                                            &lgi->lgi_fid, NULL);
01197                         if (rc < 0)
01198                                 RETURN(rc);
01199                         rc = 0;
01200                         conf.loc_flags = LOC_F_NEW;
01201                 }
01202 
01203                 o = dt_locate_at(env, dt, &lgi->lgi_fid,
01204                                  dt->dd_lu_dev.ld_site->ls_top_dev, &conf);
01205                 if (IS_ERR(o))
01206                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(o));
01207 
01208                 goto after_open;
01209         }
01210 
01211         ls = ls_device_get(dt);
01212         if (IS_ERR(ls))
01213                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(ls));
01214 
01215         mutex_lock(&ls->ls_los_mutex);
01216         los = dt_los_find(ls, name != NULL ? FID_SEQ_LLOG_NAME : FID_SEQ_LLOG);
01217         mutex_unlock(&ls->ls_los_mutex);
01218         LASSERT(los);
01219         ls_device_put(env, ls);
01220 
01221         LASSERT(handle);
01222 
01223         if (logid != NULL) {
01224                 logid_to_fid(logid, &lgi->lgi_fid);
01225         } else if (name) {
01226                 struct dt_object *llog_dir;
01227 
01228                 llog_dir = llog_osd_dir_get(env, ctxt);
01229                 if (IS_ERR(llog_dir))
01230                         GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(llog_dir));
01231                 dt_read_lock(env, llog_dir, 0);
01232                 rc = dt_lookup_dir(env, llog_dir, name, &lgi->lgi_fid);
01233                 dt_read_unlock(env, llog_dir);
01234                 lu_object_put(env, &llog_dir->do_lu);
01235                 if (rc == -ENOENT && open_param == LLOG_OPEN_NEW) {
01236                         /* generate fid for new llog */
01237                         rc = local_object_fid_generate(env, los,
01238                                                        &lgi->lgi_fid);
01239                 }
01240                 if (rc < 0)
01241                         GOTO(out, rc);
01242                 OBD_ALLOC(handle->lgh_name, strlen(name) + 1);
01243                 if (handle->lgh_name)
01244                         strcpy(handle->lgh_name, name);
01245                 else
01246                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
01247         } else {
01248                 LASSERTF(open_param & LLOG_OPEN_NEW, "%#x\n", open_param);
01249                 /* generate fid for new llog */
01250                 rc = local_object_fid_generate(env, los, &lgi->lgi_fid);
01251                 if (rc < 0)
01252                         GOTO(out, rc);
01253         }
01254 
01255         o = ls_locate(env, ls, &lgi->lgi_fid, NULL);
01256         if (IS_ERR(o))
01257                 GOTO(out_name, rc = PTR_ERR(o));
01258 
01259 after_open:
01260         /* No new llog is expected but doesn't exist */
01261         if (open_param != LLOG_OPEN_NEW && !dt_object_exists(o))
01262                 GOTO(out_put, rc = -ENOENT);
01263 
01264         fid_to_logid(&lgi->lgi_fid, &handle->lgh_id);
01265         handle->lgh_obj = o;
01266         handle->private_data = los;
01267         LASSERT(handle->lgh_ctxt);
01268 
01269         RETURN(rc);
01270 
01271 out_put:
01272         lu_object_put(env, &o->do_lu);
01273 out_name:
01274         if (handle->lgh_name != NULL)
01275                 OBD_FREE(handle->lgh_name, strlen(name) + 1);
01276 out:
01277         if (los != NULL)
01278                 dt_los_put(los);
01279         RETURN(rc);
01280 }
01281 
01295 struct dt_object *llog_osd_get_regular_fid_dir(const struct lu_env *env,
01296                                                struct dt_object *dto)
01297 {
01298         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
01299         struct seq_server_site *ss = dto->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_site->ld_seq_site;
01300         struct lu_seq_range     *range = &lgi->lgi_range;
01301         struct lu_fid           *dir_fid = &lgi->lgi_fid;
01302         struct dt_object        *dir;
01303         int                     rc;
01304         ENTRY;
01305 
01306         fld_range_set_any(range);
01307         LASSERT(ss != NULL);
01308         rc = ss->ss_server_fld->lsf_seq_lookup(env, ss->ss_server_fld,
01309                                    fid_seq(lu_object_fid(&dto->do_lu)), range);
01310         if (rc < 0)
01311                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
01312 
01313         lu_update_log_dir_fid(dir_fid, range->lsr_index);
01314         dir = dt_locate(env, lu2dt_dev(dto->do_lu.lo_dev), dir_fid);
01315         if (IS_ERR(dir))
01316                 RETURN(dir);
01317 
01318         if (!dt_try_as_dir(env, dir)) {
01319                 lu_object_put(env, &dir->do_lu);
01320                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOTDIR));
01321         }
01322 
01323         RETURN(dir);
01324 }
01325 
01341 static int
01342 llog_osd_regular_fid_add_name_entry(const struct lu_env *env,
01343                                     struct dt_object *dto,
01344                                     struct thandle *th, bool declare)
01345 {
01346         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
01347         const struct lu_fid     *fid = lu_object_fid(&dto->do_lu);
01348         struct dt_insert_rec    *rec = &lgi->lgi_dt_rec;
01349         struct dt_object        *dir;
01350         char                    *name = lgi->lgi_name;
01351         int                     rc;
01352         ENTRY;
01353 
01354         if (!fid_is_norm(fid))
01355                 RETURN(0);
01356 
01357         dir = llog_osd_get_regular_fid_dir(env, dto);
01358         if (IS_ERR(dir))
01359                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(dir));
01360 
01361         rec->rec_fid = fid;
01362         rec->rec_type = S_IFREG;
01363         snprintf(name, sizeof(lgi->lgi_name), DFID, PFID(fid));
01364         dt_write_lock(env, dir, 0);
01365         if (declare) {
01366                 rc = dt_declare_insert(env, dir, (struct dt_rec *)rec,
01367                                (struct dt_key *)name, th);
01368         } else {
01369                 rc = dt_insert(env, dir, (struct dt_rec *)rec,
01370                                (struct dt_key *)name, th, 1);
01371         }
01372         dt_write_unlock(env, dir);
01373 
01374         lu_object_put(env, &dir->do_lu);
01375         RETURN(rc);
01376 }
01377 
01378 
01392 static int llog_osd_declare_create(const struct lu_env *env,
01393                                    struct llog_handle *res, struct thandle *th)
01394 {
01395         struct llog_thread_info         *lgi = llog_info(env);
01396         struct dt_insert_rec            *rec = &lgi->lgi_dt_rec;
01397         struct local_oid_storage        *los;
01398         struct dt_object                *o;
01399         int                              rc;
01400 
01401         ENTRY;
01402 
01403         LASSERT(res->lgh_obj);
01404         LASSERT(th);
01405 
01406         /* object can be created by another thread */
01407         o = res->lgh_obj;
01408         if (dt_object_exists(o))
01409                 RETURN(0);
01410 
01411         if (res->lgh_ctxt->loc_flags & LLOG_CTXT_FLAG_NORMAL_FID) {
01412                 struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
01413 
01414                 lgi->lgi_attr.la_valid = LA_MODE | LA_SIZE;
01415                 lgi->lgi_attr.la_size = 0;
01416                 lgi->lgi_attr.la_mode = S_IFREG | S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR;
01417                 lgi->lgi_dof.dof_type = dt_mode_to_dft(S_IFREG);
01418 
01419                 rc = dt_declare_create(env, o, &lgi->lgi_attr, NULL,
01420                                        &lgi->lgi_dof, th);
01421                 if (rc < 0)
01422                         RETURN(rc);
01423 
01424 
01425                 rc = llog_osd_regular_fid_add_name_entry(env, o, th, true);
01426 
01427                 RETURN(rc);
01428         }
01429         los = res->private_data;
01430         LASSERT(los);
01431 
01432         rc = llog_osd_declare_new_object(env, los, o, th);
01433         if (rc)
01434                 RETURN(rc);
01435 
01436         /* do not declare header initialization here as it's declared
01437          * in llog_osd_declare_write_rec() which is always called */
01438 
01439         if (res->lgh_name) {
01440                 struct dt_object *llog_dir;
01441 
01442                 llog_dir = llog_osd_dir_get(env, res->lgh_ctxt);
01443                 if (IS_ERR(llog_dir))
01444                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(llog_dir));
01445                 logid_to_fid(&res->lgh_id, &lgi->lgi_fid);
01446                 rec->rec_fid = &lgi->lgi_fid;
01447                 rec->rec_type = S_IFREG;
01448                 rc = dt_declare_insert(env, llog_dir,
01449                                        (struct dt_rec *)rec,
01450                                        (struct dt_key *)res->lgh_name, th);
01451                 lu_object_put(env, &llog_dir->do_lu);
01452                 if (rc)
01453                         CERROR("%s: can't declare named llog %s: rc = %d\n",
01454                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
01455                                res->lgh_name, rc);
01456         }
01457         RETURN(rc);
01458 }
01459 
01473 static int llog_osd_create(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *res,
01474                            struct thandle *th)
01475 {
01476         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
01477         struct dt_insert_rec    *rec = &lgi->lgi_dt_rec;
01478         struct local_oid_storage *los;
01479         struct dt_object        *o;
01480         int                      rc = 0;
01481 
01482         ENTRY;
01483 
01484         LASSERT(env);
01485         o = res->lgh_obj;
01486         LASSERT(o);
01487 
01488         /* llog can be already created */
01489         if (dt_object_exists(o))
01490                 RETURN(-EEXIST);
01491 
01492         if (res->lgh_ctxt->loc_flags & LLOG_CTXT_FLAG_NORMAL_FID) {
01493                 struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
01494 
01495                 lgi->lgi_attr.la_valid = LA_MODE | LA_SIZE | LA_TYPE;
01496                 lgi->lgi_attr.la_size = 0;
01497                 lgi->lgi_attr.la_mode = S_IFREG | S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR;
01498                 lgi->lgi_dof.dof_type = dt_mode_to_dft(S_IFREG);
01499 
01500                 dt_write_lock(env, o, 0);
01501                 rc = dt_create(env, o, &lgi->lgi_attr, NULL,
01502                                &lgi->lgi_dof, th);
01503                 dt_write_unlock(env, o);
01504                 if (rc < 0)
01505                         RETURN(rc);
01506 
01507                 rc = llog_osd_regular_fid_add_name_entry(env, o, th, false);
01508 
01509                 RETURN(rc);
01510         }
01511 
01512         los = res->private_data;
01513         LASSERT(los);
01514 
01515         dt_write_lock(env, o, 0);
01516         if (!dt_object_exists(o))
01517                 rc = llog_osd_create_new_object(env, los, o, th);
01518         else
01519                 rc = -EEXIST;
01520 
01521         dt_write_unlock(env, o);
01522         if (rc)
01523                 RETURN(rc);
01524 
01525         if (res->lgh_name) {
01526                 struct dt_object *llog_dir;
01527 
01528                 llog_dir = llog_osd_dir_get(env, res->lgh_ctxt);
01529                 if (IS_ERR(llog_dir))
01530                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(llog_dir));
01531 
01532                 logid_to_fid(&res->lgh_id, &lgi->lgi_fid);
01533                 rec->rec_fid = &lgi->lgi_fid;
01534                 rec->rec_type = S_IFREG;
01535                 dt_read_lock(env, llog_dir, 0);
01536                 rc = dt_insert(env, llog_dir, (struct dt_rec *)rec,
01537                                (struct dt_key *)res->lgh_name,
01538                                th, 1);
01539                 dt_read_unlock(env, llog_dir);
01540                 lu_object_put(env, &llog_dir->do_lu);
01541                 if (rc)
01542                         CERROR("%s: can't create named llog %s: rc = %d\n",
01543                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
01544                                res->lgh_name, rc);
01545         }
01546         RETURN(rc);
01547 }
01548 
01561 static int llog_osd_close(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_handle *handle)
01562 {
01563         struct local_oid_storage        *los;
01564         int                              rc = 0;
01565 
01566         ENTRY;
01567 
01568         LASSERT(handle->lgh_obj);
01569 
01570         if (handle->lgh_ctxt->loc_flags & LLOG_CTXT_FLAG_NORMAL_FID) {
01571                 /* Remove the object from the cache, otherwise it may
01572                  * hold LOD being released during cleanup process */
01573                 lu_object_put_nocache(env, &handle->lgh_obj->do_lu);
01574                 LASSERT(handle->private_data == NULL);
01575                 RETURN(rc);
01576         } else {
01577                 lu_object_put(env, &handle->lgh_obj->do_lu);
01578         }
01579         los = handle->private_data;
01580         LASSERT(los);
01581         dt_los_put(los);
01582 
01583         if (handle->lgh_name)
01584                 OBD_FREE(handle->lgh_name, strlen(handle->lgh_name) + 1);
01585 
01586         RETURN(rc);
01587 }
01588 
01603 static int
01604 llog_osd_regular_fid_del_name_entry(const struct lu_env *env,
01605                                     struct dt_object *dto,
01606                                     struct thandle *th, bool declare)
01607 {
01608         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
01609         const struct lu_fid     *fid = lu_object_fid(&dto->do_lu);
01610         struct dt_object        *dir;
01611         char                    *name = lgi->lgi_name;
01612         int                     rc;
01613         ENTRY;
01614 
01615         if (!fid_is_norm(fid))
01616                 RETURN(0);
01617 
01618         dir = llog_osd_get_regular_fid_dir(env, dto);
01619         if (IS_ERR(dir))
01620                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(dir));
01621 
01622         snprintf(name, sizeof(lgi->lgi_name), DFID, PFID(fid));
01623         dt_write_lock(env, dir, 0);
01624         if (declare) {
01625                 rc = dt_declare_delete(env, dir, (struct dt_key *)name,
01626                                        th);
01627         } else {
01628                 rc = dt_delete(env, dir, (struct dt_key *)name, th);
01629         }
01630         dt_write_unlock(env, dir);
01631 
01632         lu_object_put(env, &dir->do_lu);
01633         RETURN(rc);
01634 }
01635 
01648 static int llog_osd_declare_destroy(const struct lu_env *env,
01649                                     struct llog_handle *loghandle,
01650                                     struct thandle *th)
01651 {
01652         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
01653         struct dt_object        *o, *llog_dir = NULL;
01654         int                      rc;
01655 
01656         ENTRY;
01657 
01658         ctxt = loghandle->lgh_ctxt;
01659         LASSERT(ctxt);
01660 
01661         o = loghandle->lgh_obj;
01662         LASSERT(o);
01663 
01664         if (loghandle->lgh_name) {
01665                 llog_dir = llog_osd_dir_get(env, ctxt);
01666                 if (IS_ERR(llog_dir))
01667                         RETURN(PTR_ERR(llog_dir));
01668 
01669                 rc = dt_declare_delete(env, llog_dir,
01670                                        (struct dt_key *)loghandle->lgh_name,
01671                                        th);
01672                 if (rc < 0)
01673                         GOTO(out_put, rc);
01674         }
01675 
01676         rc = dt_declare_ref_del(env, o, th);
01677         if (rc < 0)
01678                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
01679 
01680         rc = dt_declare_destroy(env, o, th);
01681         if (rc < 0)
01682                 GOTO(out_put, rc);
01683 
01684         if (loghandle->lgh_ctxt->loc_flags & LLOG_CTXT_FLAG_NORMAL_FID) {
01685                 rc = llog_osd_regular_fid_del_name_entry(env, o, th, true);
01686                 if (rc < 0)
01687                         GOTO(out_put, rc);
01688         }
01689 
01690 out_put:
01691         if (!(IS_ERR_OR_NULL(llog_dir)))
01692                 lu_object_put(env, &llog_dir->do_lu);
01693 
01694         RETURN(rc);
01695 }
01696 
01697 
01712 static int llog_osd_destroy(const struct lu_env *env,
01713                             struct llog_handle *loghandle, struct thandle *th)
01714 {
01715         struct llog_ctxt        *ctxt;
01716         struct dt_object        *o, *llog_dir = NULL;
01717         int                      rc;
01718 
01719         ENTRY;
01720 
01721         ctxt = loghandle->lgh_ctxt;
01722         LASSERT(ctxt != NULL);
01723 
01724         o = loghandle->lgh_obj;
01725         LASSERT(o != NULL);
01726 
01727         dt_write_lock(env, o, 0);
01728         if (!dt_object_exists(o))
01729                 GOTO(out_unlock, rc = 0);
01730 
01731         if (loghandle->lgh_name) {
01732                 llog_dir = llog_osd_dir_get(env, ctxt);
01733                 if (IS_ERR(llog_dir))
01734                         GOTO(out_unlock, rc = PTR_ERR(llog_dir));
01735 
01736                 dt_read_lock(env, llog_dir, 0);
01737                 rc = dt_delete(env, llog_dir,
01738                                (struct dt_key *)loghandle->lgh_name,
01739                                th);
01740                 dt_read_unlock(env, llog_dir);
01741                 if (rc) {
01742                         CERROR("%s: can't remove llog %s: rc = %d\n",
01743                                o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
01744                                loghandle->lgh_name, rc);
01745                         GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
01746                 }
01747         }
01748 
01749         dt_ref_del(env, o, th);
01750         rc = dt_destroy(env, o, th);
01751         if (rc < 0)
01752                 GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
01753 
01754         if (loghandle->lgh_ctxt->loc_flags & LLOG_CTXT_FLAG_NORMAL_FID) {
01755                 rc = llog_osd_regular_fid_del_name_entry(env, o, th, false);
01756                 if (rc < 0)
01757                         GOTO(out_unlock, rc);
01758         }
01759 
01760 out_unlock:
01761         dt_write_unlock(env, o);
01762         if (!(IS_ERR_OR_NULL(llog_dir)))
01763                 lu_object_put(env, &llog_dir->do_lu);
01764         RETURN(rc);
01765 }
01766 
01782 static int llog_osd_setup(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_device *obd,
01783                           struct obd_llog_group *olg, int ctxt_idx,
01784                           struct obd_device *disk_obd)
01785 {
01786         struct llog_thread_info         *lgi = llog_info(env);
01787         struct llog_ctxt                *ctxt;
01788         int                              rc = 0;
01789         ENTRY;
01790 
01791         LASSERT(obd);
01792         LASSERT(olg->olg_ctxts[ctxt_idx]);
01793 
01794         ctxt = llog_ctxt_get(olg->olg_ctxts[ctxt_idx]);
01795         LASSERT(ctxt);
01796 
01797         if (disk_obd == NULL)
01798                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01799 
01800         /* initialize data allowing to generate new fids,
01801          * literally we need a sequece */
01802         lgi->lgi_fid.f_seq = FID_SEQ_LLOG;
01803         lgi->lgi_fid.f_oid = 1;
01804         lgi->lgi_fid.f_ver = 0;
01805         rc = local_oid_storage_init(env, disk_obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.dt,
01806                                     &lgi->lgi_fid,
01807                                     &ctxt->loc_los_nameless);
01808         if (rc != 0)
01809                 GOTO(out, rc);
01810 
01811         lgi->lgi_fid.f_seq = FID_SEQ_LLOG_NAME;
01812         lgi->lgi_fid.f_oid = 1;
01813         lgi->lgi_fid.f_ver = 0;
01814         rc = local_oid_storage_init(env, disk_obd->obd_lvfs_ctxt.dt,
01815                                     &lgi->lgi_fid,
01816                                     &ctxt->loc_los_named);
01817         if (rc != 0) {
01818                 local_oid_storage_fini(env, ctxt->loc_los_nameless);
01819                 ctxt->loc_los_nameless = NULL;
01820         }
01821 
01822         GOTO(out, rc);
01823 
01824 out:
01825         llog_ctxt_put(ctxt);
01826         return rc;
01827 }
01828 
01839 static int llog_osd_cleanup(const struct lu_env *env, struct llog_ctxt *ctxt)
01840 {
01841         if (ctxt->loc_los_nameless != NULL) {
01842                 local_oid_storage_fini(env, ctxt->loc_los_nameless);
01843                 ctxt->loc_los_nameless = NULL;
01844         }
01845 
01846         if (ctxt->loc_los_named != NULL) {
01847                 local_oid_storage_fini(env, ctxt->loc_los_named);
01848                 ctxt->loc_los_named = NULL;
01849         }
01850 
01851         return 0;
01852 }
01853 
01854 struct llog_operations llog_osd_ops = {
01855         .lop_next_block         = llog_osd_next_block,
01856         .lop_prev_block         = llog_osd_prev_block,
01857         .lop_read_header        = llog_osd_read_header,
01858         .lop_declare_destroy    = llog_osd_declare_destroy,
01859         .lop_destroy            = llog_osd_destroy,
01860         .lop_setup              = llog_osd_setup,
01861         .lop_cleanup            = llog_osd_cleanup,
01862         .lop_open               = llog_osd_open,
01863         .lop_exist              = llog_osd_exist,
01864         .lop_declare_create     = llog_osd_declare_create,
01865         .lop_create             = llog_osd_create,
01866         .lop_declare_write_rec  = llog_osd_declare_write_rec,
01867         .lop_write_rec          = llog_osd_write_rec,
01868         .lop_close              = llog_osd_close,
01869 };
01870 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_osd_ops);
01871 
01872 struct llog_operations llog_common_cat_ops = {
01873         .lop_next_block         = llog_osd_next_block,
01874         .lop_prev_block         = llog_osd_prev_block,
01875         .lop_read_header        = llog_osd_read_header,
01876         .lop_declare_destroy    = llog_osd_declare_destroy,
01877         .lop_destroy            = llog_osd_destroy,
01878         .lop_setup              = llog_osd_setup,
01879         .lop_cleanup            = llog_osd_cleanup,
01880         .lop_open               = llog_osd_open,
01881         .lop_exist              = llog_osd_exist,
01882         .lop_declare_create     = llog_osd_declare_create,
01883         .lop_create             = llog_osd_create,
01884         .lop_declare_write_rec  = llog_osd_declare_write_rec,
01885         .lop_write_rec          = llog_osd_write_rec,
01886         .lop_close              = llog_osd_close,
01887         .lop_add                = llog_cat_add_rec,
01888         .lop_declare_add        = llog_cat_declare_add_rec,
01889 };
01890 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_common_cat_ops);
01891 
01913 int llog_osd_get_cat_list(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *d,
01914                           int idx, int count, struct llog_catid *idarray,
01915                           const struct lu_fid *fid)
01916 {
01917         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
01918         struct dt_object        *o = NULL;
01919         struct thandle          *th;
01920         int                      rc, size;
01921 
01922         ENTRY;
01923 
01924         LASSERT(d);
01925 
01926         size = sizeof(*idarray) * count;
01927         lgi->lgi_off = idx *  sizeof(*idarray);
01928 
01929         lgi->lgi_fid = *fid;
01930         o = dt_locate(env, d, &lgi->lgi_fid);
01931         if (IS_ERR(o))
01932                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(o));
01933 
01934         if (!dt_object_exists(o)) {
01935                 th = dt_trans_create(env, d);
01936                 if (IS_ERR(th))
01937                         GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(th));
01938 
01939                 lgi->lgi_attr.la_valid = LA_MODE;
01940                 lgi->lgi_attr.la_mode = S_IFREG | S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR;
01941                 lgi->lgi_dof.dof_type = dt_mode_to_dft(S_IFREG);
01942 
01943                 th->th_wait_submit = 1;
01944                 /* Make the llog object creation synchronization, so
01945                  * it will be reliable to the reference, especially
01946                  * for remote reference */
01947                 th->th_sync = 1;
01948 
01949                 rc = dt_declare_create(env, o, &lgi->lgi_attr, NULL,
01950                                        &lgi->lgi_dof, th);
01951                 if (rc)
01952                         GOTO(out_trans, rc);
01953 
01954                 rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, d, th);
01955                 if (rc)
01956                         GOTO(out_trans, rc);
01957 
01958                 dt_write_lock(env, o, 0);
01959                 if (!dt_object_exists(o))
01960                         rc = dt_create(env, o, &lgi->lgi_attr, NULL,
01961                                        &lgi->lgi_dof, th);
01962                 dt_write_unlock(env, o);
01963 out_trans:
01964                 dt_trans_stop(env, d, th);
01965                 if (rc)
01966                         GOTO(out, rc);
01967         }
01968 
01969         rc = dt_attr_get(env, o, &lgi->lgi_attr);
01970         if (rc)
01971                 GOTO(out, rc);
01972 
01973         if (!S_ISREG(lgi->lgi_attr.la_mode)) {
01974                 CERROR("%s: CATALOGS is not a regular file!: mode = %o\n",
01975                        o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
01976                        lgi->lgi_attr.la_mode);
01977                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
01978         }
01979 
01980         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "cat list: disk size=%d, read=%d\n",
01981                (int)lgi->lgi_attr.la_size, size);
01982 
01983         /* return just number of llogs */
01984         if (idarray == NULL) {
01985                 rc = lgi->lgi_attr.la_size / sizeof(*idarray);
01986                 GOTO(out, rc);
01987         }
01988 
01989         /* read for new ost index or for empty file */
01990         memset(idarray, 0, size);
01991         if (lgi->lgi_attr.la_size <= lgi->lgi_off)
01992                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
01993         if (lgi->lgi_attr.la_size < lgi->lgi_off + size)
01994                 size = lgi->lgi_attr.la_size - lgi->lgi_off;
01995 
01996         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = idarray;
01997         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = size;
01998         rc = dt_record_read(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, &lgi->lgi_off);
01999         /* -EFAULT means the llog is a sparse file. This is not an error
02000          * after arbitrary OST index is supported. */
02001         if (rc < 0 && rc != -EFAULT) {
02002                 CERROR("%s: error reading CATALOGS: rc = %d\n",
02003                        o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,  rc);
02004                 GOTO(out, rc);
02005         }
02006 
02007         EXIT;
02008 out:
02009         lu_object_put(env, &o->do_lu);
02010         RETURN(rc);
02011 }
02012 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_osd_get_cat_list);
02013 
02031 int llog_osd_put_cat_list(const struct lu_env *env, struct dt_device *d,
02032                           int idx, int count, struct llog_catid *idarray,
02033                           const struct lu_fid *fid)
02034 {
02035         struct llog_thread_info *lgi = llog_info(env);
02036         struct dt_object        *o = NULL;
02037         struct thandle          *th;
02038         int                      rc, size;
02039 
02040         if (count == 0)
02041                 RETURN(0);
02042 
02043         LASSERT(d);
02044 
02045         size = sizeof(*idarray) * count;
02046         lgi->lgi_off = idx * sizeof(*idarray);
02047         lgi->lgi_fid = *fid;
02048 
02049         o = dt_locate(env, d, &lgi->lgi_fid);
02050         if (IS_ERR(o))
02051                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(o));
02052 
02053         if (!dt_object_exists(o))
02054                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
02055 
02056         rc = dt_attr_get(env, o, &lgi->lgi_attr);
02057         if (rc)
02058                 GOTO(out, rc);
02059 
02060         if (!S_ISREG(lgi->lgi_attr.la_mode)) {
02061                 CERROR("%s: CATALOGS is not a regular file!: mode = %o\n",
02062                        o->do_lu.lo_dev->ld_obd->obd_name,
02063                        lgi->lgi_attr.la_mode);
02064                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
02065         }
02066 
02067         th = dt_trans_create(env, d);
02068         if (IS_ERR(th))
02069                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(th));
02070 
02071         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_len = size;
02072         lgi->lgi_buf.lb_buf = idarray;
02073         rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, lgi->lgi_off, th);
02074         if (rc)
02075                 GOTO(out_trans, rc);
02076 
02077         /* For update log, this happens during initialization,
02078          * see lod_sub_prep_llog(), and we need make sure catlog
02079          * file ID is written to catlist file(committed) before
02080          * cross-MDT operation write update records to catlog FILE,
02081          * otherwise, during failover these update records might
02082          * missing */
02083         if (fid_is_update_log(fid))
02084                 th->th_sync = 1;
02085 
02086         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, d, th);
02087         if (rc)
02088                 GOTO(out_trans, rc);
02089 
02090         th->th_wait_submit = 1;
02091 
02092         rc = dt_record_write(env, o, &lgi->lgi_buf, &lgi->lgi_off, th);
02093         if (rc)
02094                 CDEBUG(D_INODE, "can't write CATALOGS at index %d: rc = %d\n",
02095                        idx, rc);
02096 out_trans:
02097         dt_trans_stop(env, d, th);
02098 out:
02099         lu_object_put(env, &o->do_lu);
02100         RETURN(rc);
02101 }
02102 EXPORT_SYMBOL(llog_osd_put_cat_list);
